meanings.sent1: Her constant discontents made it hard for her to enjoy anything.
meanings.sent2: The discontents of the students were evident in their frowns.
meanings.sent3: The cat's discontents with the new food were clear as it refused to eat.
meanings.sent4: The discontents of the storm were felt by all as the winds howled angrily.
meanings.sent5: The discontents of the broken toy were visible in the child's disappointed face.

meanings.sent1: The difficult puzzle discontents him as he struggles to find the solution.
meanings.sent2: The poor service at the restaurant discontents the customers.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick to make the coin disappear discontents the audience in confusion.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected plot twist in the movie discontents the viewers, leaving them shocked.
meanings.sent5: The loud noise from the construction site discontents the residents living nearby.

meanings.sent1: She always plays the role of the discontents in our group, never satisfied with anything.
meanings.sent2: The discontents in the meeting voiced their concerns about the new policy.
meanings.sent3: The discontents at the party kept complaining about the music being too loud.
meanings.sent4: The discontents in the crowd were evident as they booed the speaker.
meanings.sent5: The discontents in the classroom were always looking for reasons to be unhappy.
